markdown.markdown:
**introduction**: My work bridges field experimentation and high-throughput sequencing to deliver actionable insights for corn disease management.

**ðŸŒ± Research_interests:**

-   Evaluating fungicide efficacies to optimize integrated disease management for corn - Profiling corn leaf endophyte communities and tracking their response to foliar treatments

-   Developing decision-support tools for Tar Spot disease forecasting and management

-   Implementing metagenomic sequencing and custom bioinformatics pipelines for microbial community analysis

**Skills_tools:**

-   Bioinformatics: - Kaiju for taxonomic classification - KBase workflows with SLURM-based HPC integration - Nanopore (MinION) sequencing and real-time basecalling

-   Statistical_analysis: - R (tidyverse, lme4) and Python (pandas, scikit-bio)

-   Experimental designs: full factorial, fractional, and incomplete block designs genomic_analysis: - Reference genome alignment (Minimap2) - Metagenomic profiling without de novo assembly - Learning advanced taxonomic profiling techniques

**Conferences_presentations:** - year: 2024 event: American Society for Horticultural Science (ASHS) format: Oral Presentation title: "Optimizing Fungicide Programs for Corn Tar Spot" - year: 2025 event: Plant and Animal Genome Conference (PAG) format: Poster title: "Airborne Pathogen Diversity in Corn Fields" - year: 2025 event: American Phytopathological Society (APS) format: Poster title: "Endophyte Community Shifts Following Fungicide Application"

**Additional_sections:** - section: Education description: "B.Sc. in Plant Biology, Your University, 2022" - section: Selected Publications description: "List peer-reviewed articles with DOIs" - section: Funding & Awards description: "Fellowships, grants, travel awards" - section: Teaching & Mentoring description: "Courses assisted, undergraduate mentees" - section: Outreach & Service description: "Workshops led, peer-review contributions" - section: Contact & CV description: "Link to downloadable CV, email, ORCID, Google Scholar profile"
